conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric-style render with extruded walls, visible thickness, and an exposed interior (ceiling removed).

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and volumetric rooms; angled view with readable top+side faces. Cutaway is clean but simplified (some openings/edges feel generic).

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room zoning matches (Kitchen/Living left, Bedroom top/right, bath/utility core, stair along right). However, perimeter window/door placement and counts do not closely match the 2D plan, and several internal partitions/openings are simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Basic kitchen cabinetry present. Bedroom lacks a bed; bathroom fixtures are not modeled; living furniture is minimal/blocky and not clearly matching the plan's indicated items.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with decent lighting. Text labels are present in the 3D view (UI contamination). Some elements are low-detail, reducing clarity of openings and room functions.

detected_errors.description: Doors/windows are simplified and several appear missing or not on the same walls/positions as in the 2D plan (notably perimeter window distribution).
Key furniture/fixtures from the plan are missing or not clearly represented (bedroom bed, bathroom fixtures, living area furniture).
Text labels appear in the 3D render, reducing presentation/background cleanliness.

summary: A valid 3D cutaway conversion with correct overall room zoning, but with notable simplification/mismatch in openings and missing interior fixtures/furniture relative to the 2D plan.
